instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-2936 - ME region - original rom corrupt / messed with
threads.message:
Hi There,

820-2936

With ORIGINAL ROM chip quarter fan spin
With DONOR ROM chip - boots fine.

ORIGINAL ROM chip is N25q064a.

As i don't use the TL866 very often so i found another TEST N25q064a (from a MBP 15" 2012)  to play with first to make sure i could remember how to do it.

The TEST N25q064a i can get the TL866 to ID and to read the rom so i moved onto the ORIGINAL rom

The ORIGINAL N25q064a does not ID and shows all data as blank.

So my question is can i use the DONOR rom and clean that ME region to do the job - i realise this is not ideal but would it work ?

The dumped donor rom is here:

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oRVCpcEWJ3loU1S5lr0EUUw-ZS08XCHN/view?usp=sharing[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-2936 - ME region - original rom corrupt / messed with
[SOLVED] 820-2936 - ME region - original rom corrupt / messed with
threads.message: Thank you duke, that worked perfectly. Please mark as solved.
